definition: Time, effort, or financial resources required to generate, maintain, or provide information for a collection.
Permission to collect a specific set of data from the American public.
Two four-digit numbers separated by a hyphen. The first four digits identify the sponsoring agency and bureau, and the last four identify the particular collection.
The OIRA staff member reviewing an information collection request.
A proposal and process for requesting information. PRA approval is granted to collections.
OIRA's annual report sent to Congress summarizing the major activies under PRA, and the total burden of information collection
Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs, part of the Office of Management and Budget
A law governing how federal agencies collect information from the American public.
The digital platform used by agencies to submit PRA clearance requests to OIRA.
